paragraphs: I created this page to document every step I took in building the "Support My Journey" blog â€“ a space where I share my dreams and hope to receive support from the community.

From the early days of learning how to start a blog, customizing the layout, connecting PayPal, and setting up the donation button... each step was a meaningful experience. I wanted to record it as a personal reminder and share it with anyone who might be on a similar journey.
milestones: July 5, 2025 â€“ Came up with the idea to create a personal fundraising blog.
July 5, 2025 â€“ Created the Blogspot site for fundraising equipment and searched for a theme.
July 6, 2025 â€“ Chose the blog name "Support My Journey".
July 6, 2025 â€“ Designed the website logo and favicon with blue-white tones.
July 6, 2025 â€“ Wrote the first fundraising goal post (Logitech G923).
July 6, 2025 â€“ Registered PayPal and created the donation button.
July 7, 2025 â€“ Integrated progress bar, donation history, and transparency policy.
July 8, 2025 â€“ Purchased the domain supportmyjourney.com and connected it to Blogspot. Configured DNS (Cloudflare) so Blogspot and Mail could work properly.
July 9, 2025 â€“ Added multilingual support inside posts alongside Google Translate widget, optimized for mobile.
July 9, 2025 â€“ Continued refining the in-post translation system.
July 10, 2025 â€“ Finalized the translation system and removed Google Translate due to conflicts.
July 10, 2025 â€“ Took a break... I'll continue updating with automatic donation tracking soon...
July 11, 2025 â€“ Added language support for notification pages and the About widget.
July 12, 2025 â€“ Fixed display issues on small screen devices.
July 13, 2025 â€“ Added Korean and Portuguese as new languages.

July 13, 2025 â€“ Now the website supports 8 languages (translated using AI). This increased the length of in-post HTML significantly. I decided to move all content into external JSON files (via GitHub + Cloudflare Pages) for easier management.
July 14, 2025 â€“ Faced issues with the language switcher. I standardized it into a single button with a sliding dropdown for better UI and scalability.
July 15, 2025 â€“ Optimized SEO so more people can find this site.
July 15, 2025 â€“ Testing auto-updating donation progress bar. Donation list is synced via Google Sheets, but PayPal data still needs to be manually entered due to security and simplicity reasons.
footer: Thank you for visiting this page. I hope this little journey gives you some insights or encouragement.
